definitions.definition: A plant , grown for it, or its fruits or seeds , to be harvested as food , livestock fodder , or fuel or for any other economic purpose.
examples: The farmer had to decide which crop to grow as his main bet for the coming year. Would it be barley, oats, or something else?

definitions.definition: The production amount of such an output for a specific season or year , particularly of plants .
examples: It was a good crop of oats this year. What a nice change after last year's crop !

definitions.definition: A group , cluster , or collection of things occurring at the same time.
examples: The decade produced a whole crop of ideas about space travel.
The university had an exceptional crop of graduates in 1892, including three who went on to win Nobel Prizes.

definitions.definition: A group of vesicles at the same stage of development in a disease.
examples: The patient had a crop of bumps indicative of chicken pox.

definitions.definition: The lashing end of a whip .
An entire short whip , especially as used in horse-riding.
A photograph or other image that has been reduced by removing the outer parts.

examples: She went from a ponytail to a crop .

definitions.definition: A pouch-like part of the alimentary tract of some birds (and some other animals), used to store food before digestion or for regurgitation .
The foliate part of a finial .
The head of a flower , especially when picked; an ear of corn ; the top branches of a tree .
An outcrop of a vein or seam at the surface.

main_definition: ( agriculture ) A plant , grown for it, or its fruits or seeds , to be harvested as food , livestock fodder , or fuel or for any other economic purpose.
secondary_definitions: The production amount of such an output for a specific season or year , particularly of plants .
( figurative ) A group , cluster , or collection of things occurring at the same time.
A group of vesicles at the same stage of development in a disease.
The lashing end of a whip .
An entire short whip , especially as used in horse-riding.
A photograph or other image that has been reduced by removing the outer parts.
( anatomy ) A pouch-like part of the alimentary tract of some birds (and some other animals), used to store food before digestion or for regurgitation .
( architecture ) The foliate part of a finial .
( archaic or dialect ) The head of a flower , especially when picked; an ear of corn ; the top branches of a tree .
( mining ) Tin ore prepared for smelting.
( mining ) An outcrop of a vein or seam at the surface.
